subject: Re: [junit] Problems with assertEquals()
msgSnippet: ... What exception is it throwing? -- Jason Rogers I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I
messageBody:
Daniel Zwink wrote:

>
> Hi,
>
> I'm new in testing with JUnit and have a problem with "assertEquals()".
>
> I wanna test if 2 objects are equal. The "equals()"-method in the class
> is self-written and the following asserts run fine:
>
> ----- snip -----
> MyClass object1 = new MyClass();
> MyClass object2 = new MyClass();
>
> assertTrue(object1.equals(object2));
> assertTrue(object2.equals(object1));
> assertTrue((object1 != null && object1.equals(object2)));
> ----- snap -----
>
> But if I wanna test directly with "assertEquals()" it breaks:
>
> ----- snip -----
> assertEquals("My Test", object1, object2);
> ----- snap -----
>
>
> The last line in the first code snippet is exactly the test
> "assertEquals()" performs - but it returns an exception.

What exception is it throwing?

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
